Problem:
Let us consider a system of linear differential equations represented by \\(\\dot{x} = Mx\\), where \\( M \\) is a constant coefficient matrix. We analyze the effects of applying a Fourier transform, defined as \\( F(x(t)) = \\int_{-\\infty}^\\infty x(t)e^{-iwt}dt \\), on this system over time.

If a control input represented by a matrix \\( N \\) is added into the system \\(\\dot{x} = Mx + Nu\\) and a Fourier transform is applied, will the spectrum \\( F(x(t)) \\) only reflect the properties of \\( M \\) and \\( N \\) at frequency \\( w \\)?
Explanation: Adding the control input \\( N \\) introduces additional dynamics into the system. The resulting spectrum \\( F(x(t)) \\) will then be a function not only of the matrices \\( M \\) and \\( N \\) but also of the nature and timing of the control inputs \\( u(t) \\) applied, affecting how these matrix properties are represented in the frequency domain.
